quotes.quote: The enemy of society is middle class and the enemy of life is middle age.

Probably the happiest period in life most frequently is in middle age, when the eager passions of youth are cooled, and the infirmities of age not yet begun; as we see that the shadows, which are at morning and evening so large, almost entirely disappear at midday.
Middle age is youth without levity, and age without decay.
Middle Age is that perplexing time of life when we hear two voices calling us, one saying, 'Why not?' and the other, 'Why bother?
One of the many things nobody ever tells you about middle age is that it's such a nice change from being young.
Middle age is the awkward period when Father Time starts catching up with Mother Nature.
Middle age occurs when you are too young to take up golf and too old to rush up to the net.
Middle age is when your broad mind and narrow waist begin to change places.
Middle age is when you've met so many people that every new person you meet reminds you of someone else.
The perceptions of middle age have their own luminosity.
The really frightening thing about middle age is the knowledge that you'll grow out of it.
Middle Age - later than you think and sooner than you expect.
Middle age is the time when a man is always thinking that in a week or two he will feel as good as ever.
Middle age is when a guy keeps turning off lights for economical rather than romantic reasons.
Middle age: when you begin to exchange your emotions for symptoms.
Middle age is when your age starts to show around your middle.
Middle age is when work is a lot less fun, and fun is a lot more work.
At middle age the soul should be opening like a rose, not closing like a cabbage.
Middle age is when you're old enough to know better but still young enough to do it.
Middle age is when it takes you all night to do once what once you used to do all night.
Middle age is having a choice between two temptations and choosing the one that'll get you home earlier.
Middle age snuffs out more talent than ever wars or sudden deaths do.
Middle age is when, whenever you go on holiday, you pack a sweater.
Adulthood is the ever-shrinking period between childhood and old age. It is the apparent aim of modern industrial societies to reduce this period to a minimum.
As human beings, we all mature physically from childhood to adolescence and then into adulthood, but our emotions lag behind.
Part of adulthood is searching for the people who understand you.
